items.title: LIVE: Pope Francis visits prison in Rome to open Holy Door and hold a Mass
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Pope Francis visits Rebibbia Prison in Rome, where he will symbolically open a Holy Door with inmates and preside over a Mass. Francis has dedicated the 2025 Jubilee, the once-every-25-year tradition, to the theme of hope. 

#popefrancis #rome #live

items.title: LIVE: Vigil in Thailand on 20th anniversary of 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A vigil is held in Thailand as people mark 20 years since the massive 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami that killed some 230,000 people across a dozen countries, making it one of modern history’s worst natural disasters. Read more here: https://bit.ly/4gtQtw1

#thailand #tsunami #live

items.title: LIVE: China’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs press briefing
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Watch live as Chinese Foreign Ministry officials give the daily media briefing in Beijing.

#china #politics #news

items.title: Indonesia marks 20th anniversary of tsunami that killed some 230,000 people
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
People have started gathering in prayer and are visiting mass graves in Indonesia’s Aceh province to mark 20 years since the massive Indian Ocean tsunami, one of modern history’s worst natural disasters. (AP Video shot by Taufik Kelana) Read more here: https://bit.ly/4gtQtw1

#indonesia #tsunami #news 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

items.title: Kazakhstan plane crash: Bodycam video shows emergency services arriving at site
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
An Azerbaijani airliner with 67 people onboard crashed Wednesday near the Kazakhstani city of Aktau, killing 38 people and leaving 29 survivors, a Kazakh official said. Read more here: https://bit.ly/3DGsqeN

#kazakhstan #crash #news

items.title: LIVE: Kilauea volcano eruption in Hawaii
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Live view as lava bubbles through the crust of one of the world’s most active volcanoes — Kilauea — on Hawaii’s Big Island. The eruption is confined to the volcano’s summit caldera, in a remote, closed area of Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, the Hawaii Volcano Observatory reported.

#hawaii #volcano #live

items.title: 50,000-year-old remains of a baby mammoth found in Siberia
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
The 50,000-year-old remains of a baby mammoth uncovered by melting permafrost have been unveiled to the public by researchers in Russia’s Siberia region who call it the best-preserved mammoth body ever found. Read more here: https://bit.ly/3VTVK8b

#mammoth #siberia #russia 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

This video may be available for archive licensing via https://newsroom.ap.org/home

items.title: New York taxi driver hits 6 pedestrians, 3 taken to hospital, police say
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A taxicab hit six pedestrians in midtown Manhattan on Wednesday, police said, with three people — including a 9-year-old boy — transported to hospitals for their injuries. (AP video by Aron Ranen) Read more here: https://bit.ly/40aK5UQ

#newyork #usa #news 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

items.title: Photographer recounts Haiti hospital gang attack that left two journalists dead
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Wounded journalists in bloodied clothes waited for help on the floor of Haiti's General Hospital after it was attacked by gangs a day before Christmas Day. Photographer Jean Feguens Regala, who was inside the hospital in Port-au-Prince on Tuesday, recounts his experience during the attack that killed two reporters and wounded several others. (AP video by Pierre Luxama) Read more here: https://bit.ly/4067s1U

#haiti #news 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

This video may be available for archive licensing via https://newsroom.ap.org/home

items.title: LIVE: Thailand marks 20 years since the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A 9.1 magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of the Indonesian island of Sumatra on Dec. 26, 2004, triggering a tsunami that killed around 230,000 people across a dozen countries in one of modern history’s worst natural disasters. The tsunami claimed the lives of over 8,000 people in Thailand, including many who remain missing, leaving deep scars. Read more here: https://bit.ly/4gtQtw1

#thailand #tsunami #live

items.title: Snowy owl rescued from car grille by Minnesota woman who saved another bird hours earlier
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A great gray owl and a snowy owl are being treated by experts after being rescued by a northern Minnesota woman. Read more here: https://bit.ly/4fuxyA8

#owl #news

items.title: Ukrainian soldiers celebrate Christmas on frontline of war
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
On the frontlines of eastern Ukraine, soldiers spent another Christmas at war and away from home since the February 2022 full-scale invasion (Dec. 25; AP video shot by Evgeniy Maloletka)

items.title: Palestinian Christians displaced by war reflect on Christmas
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
An elderly married Palestinian Christian couple displaced by war in the Gaza Strip missed the chance to mark Christmas in Bethlehem, saying the war separated them from their family and friends this year (Dec. 25; AP video shot by Abed Al-Kareem Han, production by Wafaa Shurafa)

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress

items.title: Families of those taken hostage by Hamas stage silent protest in Tel Aviv
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
The first night of Hanukkah, Judaism's "festival of lights", has been welcomed in Tel Aviv by residents with a silent protest for those who remain hostages in Gaza.  (Dec. 25, AP video shot by Ami Bentov)

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
